Articles.Content:
Ladies and kerbalmen, I present the Kessna 172. Modeled roughly after its real-life cousin the Cessna 172 Skyhawk, it flies like a dream and it\'s guaranteed to send your head soaring into the clouds and freefall back down give you the journey of a lifetime. Featuring a set of 3 pontoons with built-in landing gear, one of the most powerful propellers on the civilian market, fully controllable navigation lights with 4 modes and magnificent control, you WILL enjoy it.

> ![tK9lr.png](http://i.imgur.com/tK9lr.png)

> ![SKOhw.png](http://i.imgur.com/SKOhw.png)

> ![qcCQE.png](http://i.imgur.com/qcCQE.png)

*Brought to you by Kessna*^*TM*^*, manufacturing top-grade civilian airplanes since 2012.*

Warning: Note that this is not a stock aircraft.

[Download](http://www./?e8cwrge4qglyyfo)

Looks more like a Piper...

Nice design though! ![:D](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_cheesy.gif)
Ah, yes. The famous Pipers. I do agree it looks somewhat like the Piper PA-28.
Not in the slightest. This is obviously a radial-engined fighter plane, like the FW-190.
I agree. But if you can find me a built-in cockpit and shoulder wings, I\'d be glad to take them.

> 
> I agree. But if you can find me a built-in cockpit and shoulder wings, I\'d be glad to take them.

You can rotate the wings so they are flat when they are on the top.

Nice Desing!

Its Pretty fast! Can you Build a dogfight plane?

With 4 Wings. ![;)](//kerbal-forum-uploads.s3.us-west-2.amazonaws.com/emoticons/default_k_wink.gif)
